pullRequest.title: SourceChecker reorganization
pullRequest.bodyText:
This pull request moves methods around in the file to improve the file's organization.
It renames a few methods and fields.
It adds documentation.
It abstracts out two methods (to make the calling method, which used to inline the code shorter and clearer).
There are no logic changes in the pull request.

nodes.bodyText: This should be in the change log.

commit.message: Rename one overload of printMessage to printOrStoreMessage
Make a private method private; create a general method that dispatches to implementations
Adapt to changes on master branch
Remove link to method that has been deleted

nodes.bodyText: Should this method be private? Or protected? I don't see a need for package visibility.
Could we move/keep these support/debugging methods to the bottom of the file? Is there a reason to move them up?
I would also move shutdown logic towards the bottom.

I'm not sure what the "main entry point" is supposed to mean. Can you clarify?
The two methods that visitors should use are report() and message(Diagnostic.Kind kind, String msg, Object... args), so maybe list those two?

Should this method be called warnUnneededSuppressions, like the other method above?
How does a developer chose between the two version?

commit.message: Move some methods to the end of the file, and rename a method
